name: Blue Pools Canyon
description:
Introduction

THIS CANYON PAGE IS A DUPLICATE OF: https://ropewiki.com/Blue_Pool_Wash

Approach

Right off of Highway 89. Headed towards Kanab/Utah, the parking area is to the left, immediately before the bridge, down a very short dirt road (between mile marker 3 and4).

Begin a down climb into the canyon just upstream from the bridge, pretty much right at the parking area. Some say you can also enter on the opposite side of the bridge, may depend on water levels

Descent

Follow the slot canyon with a couple downclwimbs before reaching rap1.

Rap 1: 20f. From a boulder

Rap 2: 20f. Novelty anchor off of an old car engine. However there is a bolted anchor LDC, above eye height on the sloping rock.

Rap 3: 50f. Bolted. Be mindful of rope pull. A crack that is definitely a rope eater.

Exit

Shortly after the last rappel, the canyon quickly begins to open up again. A sandy walk. Once the right side wall begins to slope, look for cairns to indicate the way out. Very sloped rock with a couple of class 4 moves closer to the top. Once at the top, some cross country back towards to road and your car. There is a barbed wire fence near the road you will need to navigate past (or perhaps find the opening?)

Red tape

Beta sites

  • SummitPost.org : Blue Pools Slot Canyon
  • ToddsHikingGuide.com : Blue Pools Slot Canyon
  • [ https://www.roadtripryan.com/go/t/utah/powell/blue-pool-wash] : Blue Pools Slot Canyon
